wikipedia_page.main: William Race (5 February 1896 – 1972) was an English footballer who scored 10 goals from 59 appearances in the Football League playing on the wing for Darlington and Hartlepools United in the 1920s and 1930s. He also played non-league football for clubs including Spennymoor United and Horden Colliery Welfare. According to the Derby Daily Telegraph in 1927, he was "small, yet makes for this with an elusive trickiness".
